sense.name: a personal feeling of exhilaration
sense.examples: The children's excitement grew noticeably as Christmas Eve approached. We could barely conceal our excitement when they made the offer for our company.

sense.name: a personal state of agitation, upset
sense.examples: She tried to calm the horse's excitement when it saw a snake in the road up ahead. Through the man's excitement and gestures the firemen figured out that a child was still inside the burning building.

sense.name: a feeling of sexual arousal
sense.commentary: EXCITEMENT[+state][+personal][+exhilaration][+arousal][+sexual] Note: a narrow, specialized usage of Sense 1
sense.examples: He felt no excitement at watching anonymous naked women dance on a stage. They are afraid the teenagers will get too carried away by the excitement of heavy necking.

sense.name: a situation which causes exhilaration, joy
sense.examples: The excitement of getting to have lunch with a movie star had John in a great mood all week. The surfers talked about the excitement of riding the big waves on Oahu.

sense.name: an event that is some type of unpleasant disturbance
sense.examples: There appears to be some excitement up ahead with the swerving cars and brake lights. The passengers felt that the emergency landing was enough excitement for one day.
